text:
I only see one keyframe in your message. Here’s the state–action description for that frame, plus an assessment and next steps.

Frame 1
- State: Workspace visible. A multi-drawer plastic cabinet is on the right; the top drawer has a red label/handle area. The robot end-effector is in the lower-left, far from the cabinet, oriented roughly horizontal. No contact with the drawer yet; ample clearance.
- Action: Move-to-observation/home or initial approach; no grasp/pull attempted.

Strategy assessment
- The planned strategy (approach → align → grasp → pull) has not yet been violated; the task is simply still in the pre-grasp stage. No clear failure mode has arisen from this frame alone.

What to do next (high level)
- Perception: Localize the target drawer handle/edge; estimate its pose and opening axis.
- Pre-grasp: Move to a pose ~5–10 cm in front of the handle, align the gripper parallel to the drawer face and at handle height.
- Grasp: Close on the handle or underside lip; add a small inward seating push.
- Pull: Apply a controlled pull along the drawer’s opening axis, monitoring force/slip; pause if unexpected resistance.
- Recovery: If grasp fails or slips, re-localize, adjust orientation/height, and retry; consider a hook/side pinch if the handle is flush.
